Spencer Petri Attorneys at Law George A. Spencer Hilda N. Petri of Counsel D. Gary Spencer
517 Guitar Building Columbia, Missouri 65201 314-443-8779
div1.p: I was very happy to get your Lovely Letter. It was wonderful to hear your voice yesterday and to talk to Mrs. Young.

I know you are having a wonderful time there. I want an opportunity to talk to you and the Youngs because I fell that the situation is not just exactly what is normally right. The fact remains, however, that they are able to give you what you need now, and that is, the proper atmosphere for writing. We all strongly approve of that.
Your insurance check has been deposited and I enclose a duplicate deposit slip.
Enclosed herewith is a letter from Mr. Penington and a photo copy of a Supplemental Agreement. I am keeping the original for safety.

I think the Supplemental Agreement is satisfactory and it's a little bit more to your benefit then the way that we had hurriedly changed the original Agreement. You will note that paragraph four of the Supplemental Agreement requires that a film be made within five years from the date of the assignment. This is susceptible to interpretation, but I would think that the word "made" would require more than just a bare start toward the making of a film.
Please sign the Supplemental Agreement and return to me. I will then send it back to Mr. Pennington.
